awd_abstract_narration: The study will investigate phylogenetic relationships within the                genus Lopezia (Onagraceae) using molecular techniques involving                 chloroplast and ribosomal DNA.  Particular emphasis will be on                  (1) the relationships of the morphologically divergent sections                 within the genus, (2) the tempo, mode, and pattern of molecular                 evolution, (3) the congruence of rates of morphological and                     molecular evolution, (4) the origins of chromosome number changes               in section Pelozia, and (5) the comparative genetic variation                   within and among widespread and locally endemic species.  The                   study will integrate field and laboratory work, and will help                   clarify the relationships between molecular studies and                         phylogenetic and taxonomic studies based on morphology, cytology,               anatomy, and biochemistry.
